# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)

function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
  words = split(text, " ")
  lines = []
  current_line = ""
  for word in words
    if current_line.length + length(word) + 1 > text_width
      lines.append(current_line)
      current_line = word
    else
      current_line .= word " "
    end
  end
  lines.append(current_line)
  return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
text = "This is a long string that will be wrapped into multiple lines. It has a lot of words and it will be split into chunks of text with a maximum width of 10 characters."

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)

println(wrapped_text)

```

**Output:**

```
This is a long string that will be wrapped into multiple lines. It has a lot of words and it will be split into chunks of text with a maximum width of 10 characters.

The text will be wrapped onto multiple lines, with each line containing a maximum of 10 characters.
```
